metadata.title: CVE-2015-6564 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the mm_answer_pam_free_ctx function inmonitor.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.0 on non-OpenBSD platforms mightallow local users to gain privileges by leveraging control of the sshd uidto send an unexpectedly early MONITOR_REQ_PAM_FREE_CTX request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
openssh-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
ssh - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
ssh-krb5 - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2').
